wikipedia_page.main:
Johnny Lockett was a British professional Grand Prix motorcycle road racer who competed in the 1940s and 1950s.
He competed in the 1949 Grand Prix motorcycle racing season riding on a 500cc Norton bike and finished seventh overall with 13 points, 17 points behind fellow British rider and teammate Harold Daniell.

response: After his win in the 1949 Isle of Man Clubman event, Geoff Duke entered the 1950 Isle of Man TT only to find himself racing against formidable opposition in his first Senior TT, not only from his experienced Norton team mates, Artie Bell, Harold Daniell and Johnny Lockett, but also Les Graham on an AJS Porcupine, Reg Armstrong and Bob Foster on Velocettes. Geoff was wearing a new set of one-piece leathers and he beat them all, breaking both lap and race records in the Senior, and finishing second in the Junior TT.  It was the beginning of a spectacular racing career for Geoff Duke. IOMTT.com Geoff Duke Isle of Man career database (retrieved 5 November 2006)

He competed in the 1949 season riding a 500 cc Moto Guzzi and finished eighth overall with 7 points behind Johnny Lockett. In 1952, he won the 250 cc World Championship for Moto Guzzi.Enrico Lorenzetti career statistics at MotoGP.com
